D3D31BB0DFE401311FF868A86D17958E.description: recognize that money is a generally accepted medium of exchange and that different countries use different currencies.

D3D2D5E0DFE401311FF768A86D17958E.description: describe how the exchange of goods and services around the world creates interdependence among people in different places; and

D3D29420DFE401311FF668A86D17958E.description: describe how voluntary exchange benefits all parties involved in the exchange of goods and services;

D3D24FA0DFE401311FF568A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate how the exchange of goods and services by individuals, groups and nations creates economic interdependence and how trade results in change. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3D1C1A0DFE401311FF368A86D17958E.description: explain that government raises money by taxing and borrowing to pay for the goods and services it provides.

D3D174C0DFE401311FF268A86D17958E.description: explain that some goods and services are provided by the government; and

D3D11D70DFE401311FF168A86D17958E.description: describe how the price of a good or service in a market is related to how much of it there is and how many people want it;

D3D0D650DFE401311FF068A86D17958E.description: define a consumer and a producer and their roles in a market system;

D3D09330DFE401311FEF68A86D17958E.description: explain that a market exists whenever buyers and sellers exchange goods and services;

D3D05040DFE401311FEE68A86D17958E.description: explain that there are different economic systems in the world and that these systems use different means to produce, distribute and exchange goods and services;

D3D00B30DFE401311FED68A86D17958E.description: identify the three basic questions all economic systems must answer: What will be produced? How will it be produced? For whom will it be produced?;

D3CFBF60DFE401311FEC68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate that various economic systems coexist, and that economic decisions are made by individuals and/or governments, influenced by markets, cultural traditions, individuals and governments in the allocation of goods and services. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3CF1AC0DFE401311FEA68A86D17958E.description: identify alternative uses of resources found in their home, school or neighborhood.

D3CED0B0DFE401311FE968A86D17958E.description: explain why some countries are richer than others; and

D3CE83F0DFE401311FE868A86D17958E.description: identify and give examples of resources: human, natural and capital, and explain how they are used;

D3CE3880DFE401311FE768A86D17958E.description: identify goods and services and give an example of each;

D3CD9DF0DFE401311FE568A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate that because human, natural and capital resources are limited, individuals, households, businesses and governments must make choices. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3CD0AA0DFE401311FE368A86D17958E.description: describe how and why physical and human systems function and interact and the consequences of these interactions.

D3CCB7D0DFE401311FE268A86D17958E.description: identify locations of various economic activities and understand how physical and human factors influence them; and

D3CC65E0DFE401311FE168A86D17958E.description: explain ways in which humans use and interact with environments;

D3CC0930DFE401311FE068A86D17958E.description: explain how human and natural processes shape places;

D3CBB4E0DFE401311FDF68A86D17958E.description: use maps, globes, graphs, models, computer programs and texts, as appropriate;

D3CB6B40DFE401311FDE68A86D17958E.description: create information from maps, globes and geographic models in graphs, diagrams and charts;

D3CB2430DFE401311FDD68A86D17958E.description: explain the characteristics and purposes of maps, globes and other geographical tools and technologies;

D3CADFF0DFE401311FDC68A86D17958E.description: Students will use geographic tools and technology to explain the interactions of humans and the larger environment, and the evolving consequences of those interactions. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3CA4450DFE401311FDA68A86D17958E.description: locate major physical and human features in the New England region and the United States.

D3C9EFE0DFE401311FD968A86D17958E.description: locate places within their own and nearby communities in Connecticut; and

D3C9AB80DFE401311FD868A86D17958E.description: describe the characteristics of a physical and a human system;

D3C965F0DFE401311FD768A86D17958E.description: explain locations and characteristics of human settlements and how they have changed over time;

D3C91FA0DFE401311FD668A86D17958E.description: locate Earth's major physical and human features (including cities, countries, bodies of water, etc.);

D3C8DC50DFE401311FD568A86D17958E.description: understand the elements of culture and how they change;

D3C89230DFE401311FD468A86D17958E.description: identify the political, social and economic units of an area;

D3C84380DFE401311FD368A86D17958E.description: explain the patterns, distributions and relocations of people;

D3C7FF80DFE401311FD268A86D17958E.description: Students will interpret spatial patterns of human migration, economic activities and political units in Connecticut, the nation and the world. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3C76620DFE401311FD068A86D17958E.description: locate Earth's major physical and human features (including cities, countries, bodies of water, etc.).

D3C715F0DFE401311FCF68A86D17958E.description: draw a simple map of continents and oceans; and

D3C682F0DFE401311FCD68A86D17958E.description: explain the factors that affect the location, distribution and associations of features of the physical environment;

D3C63DB0DFE401311FCC68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate how Earth-sun relationships shape climate and vegetation patterns;

D3C5E1C0DFE401311FCB68A86D17958E.description: identify the types of physical systems and their characteristics that affect the Earth's surface;

D3C58D90DFE401311FCA68A86D17958E.description: Students will use spatial perspective to explain the physical processes that shape the Earth's surface and its ecosystems. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3E7BC40DFE40131203B68A86D17958E.description: locate major physical and human features in the New England region and the United States.

D3E77A70DFE40131203A68A86D17958E.description: locate places within their own and nearby communities in Connecticut; and

D3E73770DFE40131203968A86D17958E.description: observe and describe how places and regions are identified, defined and bounded;

D3E6F000DFE40131203868A86D17958E.description: provide reasons why and describe how places and regions change and are connected;

D3E6A470DFE40131203768A86D17958E.description: explain how human and natural processes shape places;

D3E64FE0DFE40131203668A86D17958E.description: define and identify natural and human characteristics of places;

D3E60550DFE40131203568A86D17958E.description: Students will use spatial perspective to identify and analyze the significance of physical and cultural characteristics of places and world regions. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3E572B0DFE40131203368A86D17958E.description: describe ways in which communities and nations influence each other.

D3E52F40DFE40131203268A86D17958E.description: explain how communities and nations interact with one another; and

D3E4E4A0DFE40131203168A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of how the major elements of international relations and world affairs affect their lives and the security and well-being of their community, state and nation. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3E44B40DFE40131202F68A86D17958E.description: explain that it is important to limit government so that individual rights can be protected.

D3E40250DFE40131202E68A86D17958E.description: identify what governments can and cannot do; and

D3E3A7D0DFE40131202D68A86D17958E.description: identify protection of individual rights and promotion of the common good;

D3E354F0DFE40131202C68A86D17958E.description: define and describe government in terms of people and groups who apply and enforce rules and laws;

D3E2F8D0DFE40131202B68A86D17958E.description: describe the need for a limited government so that people can be treated fairly;

D3E2A5B0DFE40131202A68A86D17958E.description: define power and authority and how they evolve into government;

D3E24EC0DFE40131202968A86D17958E.description: Students will explain that political systems emanate from the need of humans for order, leading to compromise and the establishment of authority. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3E1C140DFE40131202768A86D17958E.description: exercise political participation by discussing public issues, building consensus and becoming involved in politics.

D3E17C80DFE40131202668A86D17958E.description: explain the importance of taking an active role in political leadership and public service in their school and community; and

D3E13090DFE40131202568A86D17958E.description: establish, explain and apply criteria useful in evaluating rules and laws for solving problems and resolving conflicts between people;

D3E0CAC0DFE40131202468A86D17958E.description: identify the rights of citizens in a democratic society and explain why certain responsibilities are important to themselves, their families, community, state and nation;

D3E07E20DFE40131202368A86D17958E.description: explain the meaning and important characteristics of citizenship in the United States;

D3E03410DFE40131202268A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate knowledge of the rights and responsibilities of citizens to participate in and shape public policy, and contribute to the maintenance of our democratic way of life. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3DF9E80DFE40131202068A86D17958E.description: apply the concepts of liberty, tolerance and majority rule and how they relate to individual rights.

D3DF4980DFE40131201F68A86D17958E.description: identify the location of seats of government at the local, state and national levels; and

D3DEF640DFE40131201E68A86D17958E.description: apply the process of how leaders are selected and how people monitor and influence decisions of their government;

D3DEA2F0DFE40131201D68A86D17958E.description: identify services provided by national, state and local governments and how we pay for them through taxation;

D3DE4DB0DFE40131201C68A86D17958E.description: recognize the Constitution, including the Bill of Rights, as an important document that guides our country and limits the power of the government;

D3DDF870DFE40131201B68A86D17958E.description: explain that individuals have rights and responsibilities to follow the law;

D3DDA590DFE40131201A68A86D17958E.description: explain the purposes of laws and the ideas and principles that make just laws;

D3DD5350DFE40131201968A86D17958E.description: Students will apply knowledge of the U. S. Constitution, how the U. S. system of government works and how the rule of law and the values of liberty and equality have an impact on individual, local, state and national decisions. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3DCB5F0DFE40131201768A86D17958E.description: recognize relationships between events and people of the past and present circumstances, concerns and developments.

D3DC46E0DFE40131201668A86D17958E.description: display empathy for people who have lived in the past; and

D3DBF0B0DFE40131201568A86D17958E.description: be active learners at cultural institutions, such as museums and historical exhibitions;

D3DB99C0DFE40131201468A86D17958E.description: seek historical background when confronted with problems and issues of the past, as well as of today's world and their own lives;

D3DB57C0DFE40131201368A86D17958E.description: exhibit curiosity and pose questions about the past when presented with artifacts, records or other evidence of the past;

D3DB13B0DFE40131201268A86D17958E.description: Students will recognize the continuing importance of historical thinking and historical knowledge in their own lives and in the world in which they live. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3DA89A0DFE40131201068A86D17958E.description: identify individual achievements of scientists and inventors from many cultures and different historical periods and describe their achievements.

D3DA3760DFE40131200F68A86D17958E.description: describe the impact of various technological developments on the local community and on the nation; and

D3D9E130DFE40131200E68A86D17958E.description: describe some goods, products and ideas which were exchanged as the result of movement;

D3D98670DFE40131200D68A86D17958E.description: describe and explain some of the reasons people have moved and relate these reasons to some historic movements of large groups of people;

D3D92450DFE40131200C68A86D17958E.description: explain different types of conflict, different ways in which conflicts have been resolved, and different ways that conflicts and their resolutions have affected people;

D3D8DA40DFE40131200B68A86D17958E.description: examine family life and cultures of different peoples at different times in history;

D3D88FD0DFE40131200A68A86D17958E.description: recognize that people develop traditions that transmit their beliefs and ideals;

D3D83D80DFE40131200968A86D17958E.description: Students will apply their understanding of historical periods, issues and trends to examine such historical themes as ideals, beliefs and institutions; conflict and conflict resolution; human movement and interaction; and science and technology in order to understand how the world came to be the way it is. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3D7B5D0DFE40131200768A86D17958E.description: place the history of their own families in the context of local, state, national and world history.

D3D76E00DFE40131200668A86D17958E.description: demonstrate knowledge of major trends in state and local history, including history of original peoples, early settlements and selected changes over the past two centuries; and

D3D724D0DFE40131200568A86D17958E.description: locate the events, peoples and places they have studied in time and place (e.g., on a time line and map) relative to their own location;

D3D6C130DFE40131200468A86D17958E.description: demonstrate a familiarity with peoples, events and places from a broad spectrum of human experience through selected study from historical periods and from the various regions (e.g., East Asia, Europe, the Americas, Africa, South Asia, West Asia);

D3D65470DFE40131200368A86D17958E.description: Students will use historical thinking skills to develop an understanding of the major historical periods, issues and trends in United States history, world history, and Connecticut and local history. Educational experiences will assure that students:

D3D61330DFE40131200268A86D17958E.description: Local, United States and World History

D3D5D0E0DFE40131200168A86D17958E.description: write short narratives and statements of historical ideas and create other appropriate presentations from investigations of source materials.

D3D58EA0DFE40131200068A86D17958E.description: create timelines which sequence events and peoples, using days, weeks, months, years, decades and centuries; and

D3D54A70DFE401311FFF68A86D17958E.description: identify ways different cultures record their histories, compare past and present situations and events, and present findings in appropriate oral, written and visual ways;

D3D50430DFE401311FFE68A86D17958E.description: identify the main idea in a source of historical information;

D3D45840DFE401311FFC68A86D17958E.description: engage in reading challenging primary and secondary historical source materials, some of which is contradictory and requires questioning of validity;

D3D40A80DFE401311FFB68A86D17958E.description: gather historical data from multiple sources;

D3D3BA60DFE401311FFA68A86D17958E.description: Students will develop historical thinking skills, including chronological thinking and recognizing change over time; contextualizing, comprehending and analyzing historical literature; researching historical sources; understanding the concept of historical causation; understanding competing narratives and interpretation; and constructing narratives and interpretation. Educational experiences will assure that students:
